comment.body: There is also a snap package: https://github.com/mkg20001/zeronet-snap (just `snap install zeronet`) for all of the people using snap packages

> [p2p](#comment_111_13Z7XxTa7JuFat3KzzMWu3onwM6biLuurJ): you have not seen nofish's latest post?http://127.0.0.1:43110/Me.ZeroNetwork.bit/?Post/1RedkCkVaXuVXrqCMpoXQS29bwaqsuFdL/1J3rJ8ecnwH2EPYa6MrgZttBNc61ACFiCj/1491244225

At that time: no

> [coolplay](#comment_1_1KAKF4nVCWqJbrVPWxFvRNuU1zLkwVtC8L): cool! hello world! can we connect google through zeronet?

No, you can just visit zites through zeronet. ZeroNet is p2p and not an anonymizing layer like tor or i2p

> [delatribu](#comment_1_19pT4G4RdtCKZqN9gmEH3z8kjarBiDxM8s): "no peers found, but your content is ready to access" error when hitting "sign & publish new content" in my ZeroBlog
> What should I do to publish?

Visit your zite on a proxy like https://bit.surf:43110 right after hitting publish
